Dear Ms. Zambiasi:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff provided youth with a cell phone. After youth left the
program, staff planned an out of state trip with youth.
Investigation On 5/29/24 Complainant reported to DCWL that while Youth A
resided at the program, Youth A was given a cell phone by Staff 1.
On an unknown date, Staff 1 planned a trip out of state with Youth
A and instructed Youth A not to tell anyone so they would not get
in trouble. It is unknown if the plans were made in person, by
telephone or by other means. It was reported that Youth A
planned to go out of state with Staff 1 by informing the
independent living staff that she was traveling with a friend. No
other information is known about the planned trip or intentions of
Staff 1. Youth A moved from Vista Maria to an Independent Living
program on 5/17/24. It is unknown if Youth A had recent contact
with Staff 1. The complainant did not have direct knowledge of the
allegation. The allegation was reported to complainant by a source
that received the information second-hand. There were no
witnesses to the incident identified.
Complainant was contacted by phone on 5/29/2024. Complainant
reported they were informed Youth A had requested to have Staff
1 added to her “call list” at her new placement in independent
living. When Complainant last saw Youth A, she had a phone and
2

reported she obtained it while placed at Vista Maria. However, she
did not disclose how she obtained it.
Independent Living (IL) Staff 1 was contacted by phone on
5/29/2024 to ensure Youth A was available for an interview.
Additional contact occurred on 6/4/24, 6/12/24, 7/3/24 and 7/22/24
via email. IL Staff 1 verified that Youth A had a cell phone when
she arrived at the IL placement. Verification of Youth A’s cell
phone bill was requested from IL Staff 1. However, as Youth A
was new to the placement, she had not yet completed a budget
and had not provided a copy of her phone bill. On 7/3/21 a copy of
Youth A’s budget was sent to DCWL, which indicated a payment
of $96 for her cell phone. IL Staff 1 did not have copy of Youth A’s
phone bill to verify whose name it was in.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at her IL placement on
5/30/24. Youth A reported living at Vista Maria for approximately
six months, then recently moving to an IL placement. Youth A
reported she does not keep in contact with any staff from Vista
Maria except for her after care worker. Youth A verified that Staff 1
was not her assigned after care worker. Youth A reported she
never received any gifts from staff and has not had any contact
with anyone since leaving the program. Youth A stated she did not
have any past or current plans to take a trip with any staff and did
not know why someone would think that. Youth A reported she
owned a phone, which she bought with her own money and paid
the bill without assistance.
When asked about Staff 1, Youth A stated that she was nice, but
they were not close. Staff 1 never gave Youth A any gifts or sold
any items to her. Staff 1 contacted Youth A once after leaving the
program but never made plans to travel with Youth A. Youth A did
not provide any additional information about that contact. Youth A
reported she did not have personal relationships with any staff at
Vista Maria and did not have any concerns about staff.
On 7/16/24 a follow-up phone call occurred with Youth A. Youth A
verified that she listed two Vista Maria staff, Staff 1, and Staff 3,
as mentors on her paperwork when she began the IL program.
Youth A stated she received the phone numbers from Staff 1 and
Staff 3 directly. Youth A denied ever having phone contact with
either staff.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/30/24.
Staff 1 reported she knew Youth A, as she previously resided at
the facility. Staff 1 denied ever giving Youth A a cell phone, or any
3

other gifts. Staff 1 denied any plans to travel with Youth A. Staff 1
stated she has never had a discussion with any youth about
traveling anywhere together. Staff 1 reported she did not know
Youth A well, as she did not work in her building often. Staff 1
would see Youth A at the school on occasion, but they did not talk
or have a personal relationship. Staff 1 stated she would never
cross that boundary with a youth. Staff 1 could not think of any
reason someone would make this allegation, as she never had a
conversation with Youth A about travel. Staff 1 reported she did
not request to be on Youth A’s call list. Staff 1 was aware that
Youth A told her therapist there were a few staff that she felt may
be supportive of her transition to independent living. However,
Staff 1 never heard anything further and was informed by Youth
A’s DHHS worker that a “call list” was not needed, as Youth A had
her own phone and was able to reach out to anyone she chose.
Staff 1 again denied having any contact with Youth A since she
left the program and denied giving Youth A a phone or making any
plans to take her anywhere.
Quality Improvement (QI) Manager was interviewed face-to-face
at Vista Maria on 5/30/24. QI Manager reported she was aware of
the allegation and received an email from the therapist that Youth
A requested to have Staff 1 and another staff added to her “call
list” as approved people. As there is not a “call list”, no action was
taken, but QI Manager was informed of the request due to policy
about staff contact with youth. QI Manager did not have any
knowledge of a cell phone being provided to Youth A or plans for
a trip with Staff 1.
Independent Living (IL) Staff 2 emailed DCWL on 7/3/2024 to
report encountering Youth A while on the phone with someone
believed to be Staff 1. Youth A admitted the person she was
talking to was staff from Vista Maria but would not provide any
other information. Youth A did not provide any information about
her cell phone or plans to travel with any staff. IL Staff 2 discussed
with Youth A that a social relationship with any current or former
staff is not appropriate. Youth A was not receptive to this
information.
Staff 2 emailed DCWL on 7/11/24 to report that she took Youth A
to pay her phone bill at a Metro PCS store on 6/28/24. While at
the store, Youth A gave her name as the account holder. The
store employee pulled up the account, stated that $96 was due,
and accepted the payment. Youth A did not receive a receipt.
Therefore, documentation was unavailable to show whose
account the name was in. However, Staff 2 noted that when
4

Youth A went up to the counter, she gave her name to the
employee and they were able to look up her account.
Staff 3 was interviewed by phone on 7/16/24. Staff 3 reported that
she was not aware of any staff making plans to travel with Youth
A. Staff 3 stated she has not had any contact with Youth A since
she was discharged from the facility. However, Staff 3 recalled
that Youth A had called the unit and spoke with staff over the past
few weeks. Staff 3 was uncertain which staff spoke with Youth A.
When asked how Youth A had Staff 3’s phone number, Staff 3
stated the therapist asked for her phone number as someone that
could be a support to Youth A after leaving the program. Staff 3
stated she was aware of the agency policy regarding contact with
youth but thought she could give her phone number to Youth A if it
was approved by the right people, such as the therapist that asked
for it.
Chief Administrator was emailed on 7/3/2024 and made aware
of the information from IL Staff 2 that Staff 1 was potentially
having phone contact with Youth A. Chief Administrator stated the
issue would be addressed with Staff 1.
Follow-up occurred via email on 7/12/2024 to notify the Chief
Administrator that Youth A’s file contained names and personal
phone numbers of two Vista Maria staff (Staff 1 and Staff 3), listed
as “mentor” by Youth A.
Documents reviewed:
• Youth A’s file with the IL program contained a sheet in
which Youth A provided two names and personal cell
phone numbers of staff from Vista Maria. Youth A indicated
they were both mentors.
• Human Resources files for Staff 1 and Staff 3. Orientation
and training were completed as required. Both staff
received training on agency policies during orientation,
which included the Staff and Client Interaction Policy.
Neither staff had any disciplinary action on file regarding
contact with youth or purchasing items for youth.
• Staff and Client Interaction Policy for Vista Maria. The
policy stated the following:
• “Personal staff information such as telephone number,
address, or social media contact information must not
be shared with clients”.
• “Material goods or services must never be given or sold
by staff to clients”
5

• “Staff must not socialize with current or former clients,
except during Vista Maria sponsored activities”
Analysis Regarding the allegation that Staff 1 provided Youth A with a cell
phone and they planned to travel together, no violation was found.
Staff 1 and Youth A denied the allegation and there was no
additional evidence available.
However, a violation was found as Youth A reported having phone
contact with Staff 1 after moving to the IL program. Youth A also
had the names and personal phone numbers of two staff, and
indicated the staff provided this information to her, which is
against agency policy.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and a corrective action plan is required.
